instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Hello Team,

I have an issue with a macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (MB: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A).

When I "plug" the magsafe, I have a green light for a second (maybe less) and then nothing more after it, the battery doesn't charge.
Strangely, it's working absolutely well when I use it only on battery.

Here are the tests / changes I made:
- Used a different magsafe (known working)
- I changed the I/O board with a new one
- I changed the I/O board cable with a new one
- During one second (after "pluging" the magsafe) I have +/- 3.4v on PPBUG G3H and 0V after it (measured at L7095)

But nothing solved the issue.

I'm not sure where to start tshoot.
Can you help me with this please ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Looks like leakage on input stage.
Did you test with 45/60W original Magsafe 2 charger?
If yes, see what happens with fake charger, or lab PSU.

Post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> (measured onboard).
Check if <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is good and post <CHIP>U7010</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Hello 2informaticos[B],[/B]

thank you for taking care of my request (and the welcoming of course).

[I][U]1. Did you test with 45/60W original Magsafe 2 charger?[/U][/I]
Yes, with both of them and the result is exactly the same (green light for one second and nothing after it)

[I][U]2. If yes, see what happens with fake charger, or lab PSU. [/U][/I]
I've just check with a fake 60W magsafe 2 charger (I never use it) and the green light appeared then the orange light with the battery charging.

[I][U]3. Post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> (measured onboard).[/U] [/I]
The exact value of <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> is 68,2 kOhm

[I][U]4. Check if <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is good[/U][/I]
The <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> (Diode Zener) seems to be good (0,807 V on normal flow and infinite on the opposite flow)

[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost <CHIP>U7010</CHIP> voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]
I'm sorry, but I don't find the component <CHIP>U7010</CHIP> on schematics, where can I find it ?

I remain at your entire disposal.
Thanking you in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Sorry by mistyping; read <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> instead.

Very likely bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]

Ok so, with the fake 60W magsafe 2 charger I have:

[I]1 = 16,66 V
2 = 16,66 V
3 = 16.66 V
4 = 6,74 V
5 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
6 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
7 = [I]16.66 V[/I]
8 = [I]16.66 V[/I][/I]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
I expected voltages with original charger connected.

If board works with fake charger, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Ok, sorry

[I][U]5. P[I][U]ost <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages[/U][/I][/U][/I]

Ok so, with the official 60W magsafe 2 charger I have:

[I]1 = 135 mV (unstable)
2 = 86,6 mV (unstable)
3 = 79,9 mV (unstable)
4 = 6,74 V
5 = 7,31 V
6 = 49,4 mV
7 = 49,4 mV
8 = 7,31 V

[U]6. If board works with fake charger, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.[/U][/I]
Ok, I'll change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, and give you a feedback after it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light for a second and nothing after it, and battery doesn't charge
threads.message:
Quick update:

After replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> the battery now charge and work normally with an official magsafe 2 charger.

Thank you very much for your experience sharing and response time.
As always, your reputation precedes you.
